message: Yesterday was my first exposure, so I don't know if it's any *less*.

I saw a friend playing Magicka yesterday, so I bought it on a whim. It's a very clever idea, and another rare genuinely funny game. A lot of the fun comes from the chaos of experimentation, and how easy it is to blow yourself up.

There's something very indie about the execution though - it often feels like things aren't working when they should, and it makes a game that's style on the perfectly precise Diablo games feel finicky and frustrating. That said, it's a great way to spend a day or few with up to four friends, and co-op games automatically get high points from me, so I recommend it.
If anyone ever wants to play it as a group excursion, I'm always keen.

SOCOM 4 - Bleh. I suppose it's *competent*, but the missions and set pieces are so generic and uninspired that the game is pretty boring. The combat has nothing setting itself apart, and the "tactical" elements have been so simplified that even calling this a tactical shooter is a lie; mainstream shooters such as Bad Company offer deeper, tactical elements. What's worse, the game micro-manages you at all times; you're really just following very specific orders instead of getting to *think* tactically, which kills any chance for immersion. Honestly, avoid this one.

Finished Forgotten Sands, talk about your abrupt endings, huh? Even the post-credits sequence (which was clearly a rush job to save face) practically ended mid sentence. In all I actually enjoyed it though. It's by no measure as good as any of the previous games, but it more or less holds its own.

Some thoughts:

- There needed to be about twenty three times as few deathtrap corridors as there were.
- Gosh darn, was that combat easy. I think it's an improvement on Sands of Time's though. ;p
- The water ability was the *best*. The platforming sections towards the end of the game (triple waterfall, *so intense*) were fantastic. The last bit before the final boss was also excellent.
- The final boss was not excellent.
- The vultures made ZERO SENSE. I mean, seriously, random pockets of Djinn energy would have been a better fit.
- The writing was so very mediocre. It was tragic to hear them trying to live up to the snarky one liners of Sands of Time and 2008 and fail miserably.
- Can't say I ever used any D-pad abilities, heck the entire upgrade tree didn't need to be there. I like you, PoP, you don't have to imitate God of War.
